    • Method Detail

      • linearFilter

        public static Image linearFilter(Image image,
                                 Jama.Matrix kernel,
                                 double div,
                                 double offset,
                                 Extrapolation extrapolation)
        Convolves an image with the kernel. Common-used method for apply linear matrix filter.

        For example, we have matrix kernel: 

             0 1 2
   +-------+
 0 | 1 1 1 |
 1 | 1 1 1 |
 2 | 1 1 1 |
   +-------+
        with div = 9 and offset = 0.

        For each pixels we select aperture (using extrapolation on the image borders): 

             0 1 2
   +-------+
 0 | o o o |
 1 | o x o |
 2 | o o o |
   +-------+
        and multiply each value from aperture to corresponding value from kernel. For example value in position (0, 1) from aperture will be multiply to value (0, 1) from kernel.

        Then all multiplied values are summarized, divided to div value and to the result added offset value.

        Result of this operations saved into output image into corresponding position.

        Links:
        1. Linear filter -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernel - Kernel to perform convolution. Should have odd size both all dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        div - Coefficient to division.
        offset - Value to offset the result.
        extrapolation - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying linear filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • separableFilter

        public static Image separableFilter(Image image,
                                    Jama.Matrix kernelFirst,
                                    Jama.Matrix kernelSecond,
                                    double div,
                                    double offset,
                                    Extrapolation extrapolation)
        Implement separable filter (2 consistent linear transformations with first and second filter).
        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernelFirst - Kernel to perform convolution at first step. Should have odd size for all dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        kernelSecond - Kernel to perform convolution at second step. Should have odd size for all dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        div - Coefficient to division.
        offset - Value to offset the result.
        extrapolation - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying separable filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • threshold

        public static Image threshold(Image image,
                              int threshold,
                              Threshold thresholdMethod,
                              int maxVal)
        Threshold filter.

        Links:
        1. Thresholding (image processing) -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        threshold - Threshold value.
        thresholdMethod - Threshold method.
        maxVal - If current color value more than threshold, set this value.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying threshold filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • threshold

        public static Image threshold(Image image,
                              int threshold,
                              Threshold thresholdMethod)
        Same as threshold(Image, int, Threshold, int), but uses Color.MAX_VALUE as default maximal value.

      • adapriveThreshold

        public static Image adapriveThreshold(Image image,
                                      int blockSize,
                                      ThresholdAdaptive thresholdMethod,
                                      int C,
                                      int maxVal)
        Adaptive threshold.

        Links:
        1. Adaptive Thresholding -- HIPR2.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        blockSize - Size of block for detection threshold value for current pixel.
        thresholdMethod - Adaptive threshold method.
        maxVal - If current color value more than threshold, set this value.
        C - Constant subtracted from the mean or weighted mean. Should be in interval 0..255.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying adaptive threshold filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • adapriveThreshold

        public static Image adapriveThreshold(Image image,
                                      int blockSize,
                                      ThresholdAdaptive thresholdMethod,
                                      int C)
        Same as adapriveThreshold(Image, int, ThresholdAdaptive, int, int), but uses Color.MAX_VALUE as default maximal value.

      • calculateOtsuThresholdValue

        public static int calculateOtsuThresholdValue(Image image)
        Calculate value for threshold by Otsu method.

        Links:
        1. Otsu's method -- Wikipedia.
        2. Otsu H. -- A Threshold Selection Method from Gray-Level Histograms. 1979.

      • gradientFilter

        public static Image gradientFilter(Image image,
                                   Jama.Matrix derivativeX,
                                   Jama.Matrix derivativeY,
                                   double scale,
                                   Extrapolation extrapolation)
        Gradient filter by X and Y dimensions.

        This method is useful for creation own gradient methods.

        Algorithm:

        1. Convolve aperture with kernel derivativeX and save result as Gx.
        2. Convolve aperture with kernel derivativeY and save result as Gy.
        3. Calculate gradient by formula G = SQRT(Gx2 + Gy2).

        Links:
        1. Image gradient -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        derivativeX - Derivative values for X-dimension. Should have same size as derivativeY.
        derivativeY - Derivative values for Y-dimension. Should have same size as derivativeX. Needed to normalize values of different derivatives.
        scale - Scale parameter.
        extrapolation - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying gradient filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • edgeDetection

        public static Image edgeDetection(Image image,
                                  EdgeDetect edgeDetectionMethod,
                                  double scale,
                                  Extrapolation extrapolation)
        Edge detection algorithms.

        Based on gradientFilter(Image, Matrix, Matrix, double, Extrapolation).

        Links:
        1. Edge detection -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        edgeDetectionMethod - Edge detection method.
        scale - Scale parameter for values in result image.
        extrapolation - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying detecting edges filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • edgeDetection

        public static Image edgeDetection(Image image,
                                  EdgeDetect edgeDetectionMethod)
        Same edgeDetection(Image, EdgeDetect, double, Extrapolation), but uses 1.0 as default scale and Extrapolation.REFLECT as default extrapolation method.

      • edgeDetection

        public static Image edgeDetection(Image image)
        Same edgeDetection(Image, EdgeDetect, double, Extrapolation), but uses EdgeDetect.SOBEL as default edge detection method, 1.0 as default scale and Extrapolation.REFLECT as default extrapolation method.

      • getGaussianKernel

        public static Jama.Matrix getGaussianKernel(int kernelSize,
                                            double sigma2)
        Release Gaussian kernel for Gaussian filter as a vector with size (width, 1).

        Used formula: 

         G(x) = alpha * exp{-(x2) / (2 * sigma2)}
        where alpha is a scalable parameter to sum(G(x, y)) == 1.0.

        Uses into gaussianBlur(Image, Size, double, double, Extrapolation).

        Links:
        1. Gaussian filter -- Wikipedia.

      • getGaussianKernel

        public static Jama.Matrix getGaussianKernel(int kernelSize)
        Same as getGaussianKernel(int, double), but uses getSigma(int) as default sigma2 value.

      • getKernelSize

        public static int getKernelSize(double sigma)
        Return size of one dimension base on sigma value.

        Uses into gaussianBlur(Image, Size, double, double, Extrapolation).

      • getSigma

        public static double getSigma(int size)
        Return sigma base on size value of one dimension for Gaussian blur.

      • gaussianBlur

        public static Image gaussianBlur(Image image,
                                 Size kernelSize,
                                 double sigmaX,
                                 double sigmaY,
                                 Extrapolation extrapolationMethod)
        Gaussian blur.

        Links:
        1. Gaussian blur -- Wikipedia.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernelSize - Size of kernel for applying filter. Should have odd size for both dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        sigmaX - Sigma value by X dimension (see formula).
        sigmaY - Sigma value by Y dimension (see formula).
        extrapolationMethod - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying Gaussian blur filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • morphology

        public static Image morphology(Image image,
                               Size kernelSize,
                               Morphology morphologyMethod,
                               int iterations,
                               Extrapolation extrapolationMethod)
        Morphology transformation.

        Links:
        1. Mathematical morphology -- Wikipedia.
        2. Haralick R. M., Sternberg S., Zhuang X. -- Image Analysis Using Mathematical Morphology. 1987.

        Parameters:
        image - Source image.
        kernelSize - Size of kernel for applying filter. Should have odd size for both dimensions (1, 3, 5, ...)!
        morphologyMethod - Morphology method.
        iterations - Number of applying this filter to source image.
        extrapolationMethod - Extrapolation method.
        Returns:
        Image with result of applying morphology filter. Have same size, number of channels and type as a source image.

      • morphology
